intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium retyezatense subsp. retyezatense, commonly known as the Retyezatense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, erect flowering stem. The plant produces yellowish to reddish composite flower heads, which consist of numerous small florets. It thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
